cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest tonight and then northwest toward the central Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches extend from the mouth of the Mississippi River eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border and inland lakes around New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge and tropical-storm warnings in effect along the Louisiana coast from the mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast, especially Louisiana and Mississippi; minimal direct impact expected along the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤9%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 30-35 mph possible Friday night–Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm surge expected at Port Freeport (less than 1 ft possible)
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could produce 1–3 inches of rainfall through Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and dangerous rip currents along the upper Texas coast may disrupt vessel movements
